text: ਆਸਾ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀਉ ਕੇ ਪੰਚਪਦੇ ੯ ਦੁਤੁਕੇ ੫
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

transliteration.text: āsā srī kabīr jīu kē panchapadē 9 dutukē 5

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਪਾਤੀ ਤੋਰੈ ਮਾਲਿਨੀ ਪਾਤੀ ਪਾਤੀ ਜੀਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You tear off the leaves, O gardener, but in each and every leaf, there is life.

transliteration.text: pātī tōrai mālinī pātī pātī jīu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਜਿਸੁ ਪਾਹਨ ਕਉ ਪਾਤੀ ਤੋਰੈ ਸੋ ਪਾਹਨ ਨਿਰਜੀਉ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: That stone idol, for which you tear off those leaves - that stone idol is lifeless. ||1||

transliteration.text: jis pāhan kau pātī tōrai sō pāhan nirajīu .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In this, you are mistaken, O gardener.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The True Guru is the Living Lord. ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਬ੍ਰਹਮੁ ਪਾਤੀ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਡਾਰੀ ਫੂਲ ਸੰਕਰਦੇਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Brahma is in the leaves, Vishnu is in the branches, and Shiva is in the flowers.

transliteration.text: braham pātī bisan dārī phūl sankaradēu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਤੀਨਿ ਦੇਵ ਪ੍ਰਤਖਿ ਤੋਰਹਿ ਕਰਹਿ ਕਿਸ ਕੀ ਸੇਉ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When you break these three gods, whose service are you performing? ||2||

transliteration.text: tīn dēv pratakh tōrah karah kis kī sēu .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਪਾਖਾਨ ਗਢਿ ਕੈ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਕੀਨ੍ਹੀ ਦੇ ਕੈ ਛਾਤੀ ਪਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The sculptor carves the stone and fashions it into an idol, placing his feet upon its chest.

transliteration.text: pākhān gadh kai mūrat kīnhī dē kai shātī pāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਜੇ ਏਹ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਸਾਚੀ ਹੈ ਤਉ ਗੜ੍ਹਣਹਾਰੇ ਖਾਉ ॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If this stone god was true, it would devour the sculptor for this! ||3||

transliteration.text: jē ēh mūrat sāchī hai tau garhanahārē khāu .3.

text: ਭਾਤੁ ਪਹਿਤਿ ਅਰੁ ਲਾਪਸੀ ਕਰਕਰਾ ਕਾਸਾਰੁ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Rice and beans, candies, cakes and cookies

transliteration.text: bhāt pahit ar lāpasī karakarā kāsār .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਭੋਗਨਹਾਰੇ ਭੋਗਿਆ ਇਸੁ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਕੇ ਮੁਖ ਛਾਰੁ ॥੪॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: - the priest enjoys these, while he puts ashes into the mouth of the idol. ||4||

transliteration.text: bhōganahārē bhōgiā is mūrat kē mukh shār .4.

text: ਮਾਲਿਨਿ ਭੂਲੀ ਜਗੁ ਭੁਲਾਨਾ ਹਮ ਭੁਲਾਨੇ ਨਾਹਿ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The gardener is mistaken, and the world is mistaken, but I am not mistaken.

transliteration.text: mālin bhūlī jag bhulānā ham bhulānē nāh .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਹਮ ਰਾਮ ਰਾਖੇ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਕਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਰਾਇ ॥੫॥੧॥੧੪॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, the Lord preserves me; the Lord, my King, has showered His Blessings upon me. ||5||1||14||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr ham rām rākhē kripā kar har rāi .5.1.14.
